headline: US online sales surge to $44.2 billion during five-day holiday shopping, Adobe Analytics says
summary: U.S. shoppers spent $14.25 billion on Cyber Monday, pushing total online sales over the Thanksgiving weekend to $44. billion, according to an Adobe Analytics report, as consumers lapped up offers on ‌everything from gadgets to household essentials. Spending rose 7.7% during the so-called Cyber Week - the five days ‌from Thanksgiving to Cyber Monday - compared with an 8.2% increase to $41.1 billion last year, the report added.

headline: Shopify Suffered an Outage at the Worst Possible Time. What to Make of the Stock’s Cyber Monday Slump.
summary: Shares of  Shopify  tumbled 5.9% on Monday after the widely used e-commerce platform reported technology issues impacting some merchants.  “Merchants may experience issues when trying to login to Shopify,” the company said on its status site on Monday morning.  The issue had been mitigated by Monday evening, Shopify said in a statement on social media.

headline: Shopify Breaks Down on Busy Cyber Monday
summary: The outage at the e-commerce host interrupted transactions for merchants who use Shopify’s technology to sell products online.
